intro: Aspidostemon dolichocarpus, commonly known as the long-fruited aspidostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with simple, opposite leaves. Its flowers are small and yellowish, clustered in inflorescences, and it produces a unique, spindle-shaped capsule as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
